job_description:
Marketing Web Developer

OPEX Corporation is more than a manufacturer of machines. We continuously reimagine technology to power the future for our customers.

With an innovative approach, we engineer unique automated solutions that support our customers so they can solve the most pressing business challenges for both today and tomorrow. Our scalable Warehouse, Document, and Mail Automation solutions improve workflow, accelerate change, and drive efficiencies in infrastructure.

We are a family-owned and operated business with more than 1600 committed employees who innovate, manufacture, install, and service products that are helping transform industry every day. We listen to our customers, respect each other, and work together to help reimagine the future through automated solutions.

At OPEX, we are Next Generation Automation.

About the Role

We're seeking a talented Marketing Web Developer to build, enhance, and maintain our digital marketing infrastructure. Reporting to the Manager of Global Demand Generation, you'll be the technical architect behind our marketing web presence—creating high-performance landing pages, custom WordPress solutions, and marketing automation integrations that drive measurable business results.

You'll work to translate marketing strategies into compelling digital experiences while collaborating closely with our Digital Marketing Specialist to optimize our entire digital ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities

WordPress Development & Architecture
• Design and develop custom WordPress themes, plugins, and functionality tailored to marketing needs
• Build and maintain complex page templates and reusable components
• Optimize WordPress performance, security, and scalability
• Implement headless WordPress solutions when appropriate

Marketing Technology Integration
• Integrate marketing automation platforms (HubSpot)
• Develop custom integrations between marketing tools via APIs
• Implement tracking pixels, conversion tracking, and tag management
• Build custom dashboards and reporting tools

Landing Page & Campaign Development
• Create high-converting landing pages with A/B testing capabilities
• Build responsive email templates and marketing components
• Develop interactive tools, calculators, and lead generation assets
• Implement progressive profiling and dynamic content personalization

Front-End Development
• Write clean, maintainable HTML5, CSS3/SASS, and JavaScript (ES6+)
• Develop responsive, mobile-first designs that match brand standards
• Ensure cross-browser compatibility and accessibility (WCAG 2.1)
• Optimize front-end performance (Core Web Vitals, lazy loading, etc.)

Collaboration & Technical Leadership
• Partner with the Digital Marketing Specialist on implementation strategy
• Translate marketing requirements into technical specifications
• Provide technical guidance to marketing team on feasibility and best practices
• Document code, processes, and technical decisions

Required Skills & Experience

Core Technical Skills
• 3-5 years of professional web development experience
• Expert-level WordPress development (custom themes, plugins, hooks, filters)
• Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery
• Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (React, Vue, or similar)
• PHP development experience (object-oriented)
• Git version control and collaborative development workflows

Marketing Technology
• Experience integrating marketing automation platforms (HubSpot preferred)
• Understanding of marketing analytics and conversion tracking
• Familiarity with CRM integrations and data flow
• Experience with form builders and lead capture systems

Development Practices
• Responsive and mobile-first design implementation
• Performance optimization techniques
• Web accessibility standards (WCAG)
• Security best practices for web applications
• Cross-browser testing and debugging

Professional Competencies
• Ability to translate marketing goals into technical solutions
• Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
• Clear communication with non-technical stakeholders
• Self-directed with strong project management skills
• Attention to detail and quality assurance mindset

Beneficial Additional Skills

Advanced Development
• Headless CMS: Experience with WordPress REST API, Next.js, or Gatsby
• Modern Build Tools: Webpack, Gulp, npm/yarn workflows
• CSS Frameworks: Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, Foundation
• Animation: GSAP, Lottie, CSS animations for engaging experiences
• Testing: Jest, Cypress, PHPUnit for automated testing

Marketing Technology Stack
• Marketing Automation: HubSpot
• Analytics: Google Analytics 4, HotJar
• Tag Management: Google Tag Manager
• Personalization: Optimizely, VWO, Dynamic Yield

Extended Capabilities
• Backend Development: Node.js, Python, or other server-side languages
• Database: MySQL, PostgreSQL query optimization
• Cloud Platforms: AWS (CloudFront, S3, Lambda), Google Cloud
• DevOps: CI/CD pipelines, Docker, deployment automation
• Design Tools: Figma, Adobe XD for design-to-code workflow
• SEO Technical Implementation: Schema markup, structured data, XML sitemaps
• International/Multilingual: WPML
• Video Integration: Custom video players, streaming optimization

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or related field (or equivalent experience)
• Portfolio demonstrating marketing websites, landing pages, and custom WordPress development
• Experience in B2B or manufacturing industry environment preferred
• Demonstrated ability to balance technical excellence with marketing objectives

What You'll Bring
• Passion for writing clean, efficient, maintainable code
• Marketing mindset with understanding of lead generation and conversion optimization
• Proactive approach to staying current with development trends
• Collaborative spirit with ability to work across marketing and technical teams
• Results-driven focus on measurable business impact

The salary range for this position is $90K-$110K, based on experience.

Qualifications: 3-5 years of professional web development experience
Expert-level WordPress development (custom themes, plugins, hooks, filters)
Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (React, Vue, or similar)

job_publisher: Higher Education Recruitment Consortium (HERC), HERC Jobs

apply_options.publisher: Higher Education Recruitment Consortium (HERC), HERC Jobs

job_description:
Plans, designs, and develops web assets, templates, digital content, and brand standards within the guidelines, frameworks, best practices, policies, and restraints of university-wide content management systems. Ensures the day-to-day functionality of the assigned area's operations and services as related to any assigned program, initiative, or objective.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities: Provides front-end development working with Drupal content management system. Assists with development of user interface designs.

Writes and implements code in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript/jQuery to enhance website functionality. Works with graphic and web development tools to design website elements in CMS.

Creates web applications using Drupal Webform or Views.

Troubleshoots issues related to design and functionality of websites.

Works on projects initiated by departmental request; includes meeting with department representatives as needed in order to establish goals and objects. Provides ongoing communication with departments from inception to implementation of project, as well as ongoing support as needed.

Ensures quality control of content in terms of spelling, grammar, and general readability. Ensures that code and content meets ADA standards.

Monitors, evaluates and recommends web design standards, updates, features and conventions to be utilized for technical and brand standards.

Works closely with other members of the web team on projects where needed. Interacts with student developers in an educational or support capacity as needed.

Recommends modules where appropriate.

Regularly communicates with supervisor and other staff, including student workers, as required or needed in the completion of daily tasks in support of the department's/division's overall goals and objectives.

Prepares and maintains accurate records of daily tasks in accordance with the department's/division's (or University's) policies and procedures and assures timely communication with supervisor, staff, and students where appropriate.

Gathers data and prepares reports and other information/documentation for supervisory review?related to the department's/division's programs and/or services, or one or more assigned components thereof.

Remains informed of current developments and procedures pertinent to duties; participates in staff development activities; attends meetings, conferences, and other events.

Other Functions and Responsibilities: Assists with training new hires.

Performs other duties as assigned and/or required that are within the level of responsibility for this classification at the discretion of the supervisor.

Equipment Operated: Computer and all other standard office equipment.

Work Schedule: Typically, Monday through Friday.

Supervision Exercised: May exercise supervision over student employees.

Reports to: Associate Director, Marketing and Advertising

Required Certifications, Training, and/or Licensures: Must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of: University policies and procedures*; office practices and procedures; department/division goals and objectives*; department/division policies and procedures*; workplace safety practices and procedures*; English grammar and spelling; records management; office management; project management.

Skill in: Use of office equipment; typing, data entry; computer operation; use of computer software and other programs applicable to the assigned department/division*.

Ability to: Collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions; determine material and equipment needs; compile and prepare reports; use proper research methods to gather data; understand a variety of written and/or verbal communications; maintain records according to established procedures; effectively interact with personnel and public to answer routine questions; train or instruct others; move quickly and effectively from one tasks to another; work independently and in a team environment; develop and maintain effective working relationships.

(*) Developed after employment.

Minimum Qualifications: At least a bachelor's degree in computer science, computer information systems, web design, interactive media design, or another related field; two or more years of experience in front-end user interface design, user experience design, and/or dynamic website development; experience writing code in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript/jQuery; experience with Bootstrap framework; experience working in responsive website design; working knowledge, including coursework or online tutorials, of flexbox layout; experience creating web forms; familiarity with website accessibility compliance, i.e. ADA compliance; and customer service experience; and must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Preferred Qualifications: Experience working with Drupal Content Management System. Experience working with WordPress Content Management System, specifically utilizing Elementor page builder. Familiarity with UI/UX design tools such as Adobe XD and/or Figma. Familiarity with image editing tools such as Adobe Photoshop and/or GIMP.

Qualifications: Required Certifications, Training, and/or Licensures: Must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis

job_title: Senior Web Developer: Lead Secure, High-Impact Web Apps Job at Peraton in Falls
job_description:
A next-generation national security company is seeking an experienced Senior Web Developer to innovate and design web-based applications. The ideal candidate will have strong skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks like React. With responsibilities that include project management and user-focused design, this role offers a competitive salary range of $104,000 to $166,000, influenced by experience and geographic location. Candidates must have a BS/BA and be US Citizens with the ability to obtain a Public Trust.

job_description:
iOS & React Native Developer

BeaconFire is based in Central NJ, specializing in Software Development, Web Development, and Business Intelligence. looking for candidates with a strong background in Software Engineering or Computer Science for an iOS & React Native Developer position.

Job Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with the team to design and develop high quality iOS and React Native applications using Swift, JavaScript, and related technologies.
• Write clean and efficient code, and ensure code maintainability and reusability.
• Perform code reviews to ensure code quality and consistency.
• Conduct testing to ensure application quality.
• Create and maintain technical documentation for iOS and React Native applications.
• Participate in project planning, estimation and prioritization.
• Stay up to date with the latest developments in mobile development.

Requirement:
• Experience in iOS development using Swift.
• Experience in React Native development using JavaScript or TypeScript.
• Strong understanding of iOS development framework, such UIKit and SwiftUI.
• Proficient in Swift programming language and experience with Xcode IDE.
• Decent understanding of the software development/testing life cycle.
• Knowledge of iOS design patterns, such as MVC and MVVM.
• Experience with version control tools, such as Git.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
• 0-1 year of professional experience in either iOS or React Native development.
• Experience using CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins.
• Experience with Cloud services, such as AWS.

Compensation: $65,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year

Beaconfire is an e-verified company and provides equal employment opportunities (visa sponsorship provided).

Qualifications: looking for candidates with a strong background in Software Engineering or Computer Science for an iOS & React Native Developer position
Experience in iOS development using Swift
Experience in React Native development using JavaScript or TypeScript
Strong understanding of iOS development framework, such UIKit and SwiftUI
Proficient in Swift programming language and experience with Xcode IDE
Decent understanding of the software development/testing life cycle
Knowledge of iOS design patterns, such as MVC and MVVM
Experience with version control tools, such as Git
Responsibilities: Collaborate with the team to design and develop high quality iOS and React Native applications using Swift, JavaScript, and related technologies
Write clean and efficient code, and ensure code maintainability and reusability
Perform code reviews to ensure code quality and consistency
Conduct testing to ensure application quality

Stay up to date with the latest developments in mobile development

job_description:
A leading technology recruitment firm in Houston is seeking an experienced Software Engineer to own and deliver full-stack software projects. This role involves roughly equal front-end and back-end development and requires expertise in C++, C#, and .NET. The ideal candidate will thrive in an Agile environment and enjoy taking ownership of projects. The position offers a salary of up to $155,000 plus a bonus, along with generous PTO, healthcare plans, and 401(k) matching.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

job_title: Web Developer at Kodelinkers United States
job_description:
Web Developer job at Kodelinkers. United States.

We are looking for a Technical Support who has familiarity with web development and is comfortable being the primary contact for clients. The daily technical work is handled by our team, so your involvement stays light and focused on communication and general oversight.

Requirements:
• Must be a US citizen (no exceptions)
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Experience with technical customer support
• Basic to intermediate experience with web development
(Languages like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, PHP, Python, or others are a bonus)
• Reliable, detail-oriented, and organized

Hours & Pay:
• Part-time to start (5–10 hours/week)
• Hourly rate based on experience

To Apply:
• Confirm you are a US citizen .
• Briefly describe your experience with both support/assistant roles and coding.
• Include your availability and hourly rate.

Looking forward to working with someone proactive and tech-savvy.

Qualifications: We are looking for a Technical Support who has familiarity with web development and is comfortable being the primary contact for clients

Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience with technical customer support
Basic to intermediate experience with web development
(Languages like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, PHP, Python, or others are a bonus)
Reliable, detail-oriented, and organized

job_description:
Respiratory Therapist Opportunity

A leading healthcare provider in Mountain View, CA seeks a skilled Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) to join their team. This exciting opportunity offers the chance to work with a dedicated team of professionals and contribute to the delivery of high-quality patient care.

The ideal candidate will possess excellent clinical skills, strong communication abilities, and a passion for delivering exceptional patient outcomes. If you are motivated by challenges and driven by excellence, this position may be an excellent fit for you.

Clinical expertise as a Certified Respiratory Therapist (CRT) or Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT)

Qualifications: The ideal candidate will possess excellent clinical skills, strong communication abilities, and a passion for delivering exceptional patient outcomes
If you are motivated by challenges and driven by excellence, this position may be an excellent fit for you
Clinical expertise as a Certified Respiratory Therapist (CRT) or Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT)

Webomaze is looking for an experienced and skilled developer with proficiency in Python programming.

We need a candidate who can work on effective development, enhancement, modification, & maintenance of applications along with expertise on object-oriented designs.
Anyone who is curious, logical, and persistent with the heart of a techie is preferred profoundly.

Bachelor Degree (B.Tech, M.Tech, BCA, MCA, B.Sc IT, M.SC IT, MBA (IT)
Candidates with minimum 3 years of experience are preferred

job_title: Web Developer - Remote at Get It Recruit - Information Technology Chester County, PA
job_description:
Web Developer - Remote job at Get It Recruit - Information Technology. Chester County, PA. We are a leader in transforming employee feedback into actionable business intelligence and earning prestigious recognition as an employer of choice. With 14 years of culture research and insights gathered from 23 million employees across over 70,000 organizations, we provide the most accurate competitive benchmarks in the industry. Utilizing patented analytic tools and expert guidance, our clients create engaged workforces and foster people-first cultures.

At the heart of our mission are diversity and inclusion, cultivating an environment where everyone can thrive.

What We're Looking For:
Skilled Back-End Developer
Are you a tech enthusiast with a passion for enhancing user experiences behind the scenes? We are seeking a talented back-end developer to join our team and play a vital role in our growth and success.

What You'll Do:
Collaborate with Marketing: Bring customized web experiences to life.
Drive Conversions: Develop interactive user experiences that enhance web conversions.
Ensure Security: Safeguard our websites, both front and back end.
Innovate: Create smart, interactive experiences through APIs and other infrastructures.
Maintain & Update: Regularly update websites, including plugins and features.
Troubleshoot: Resolve bugs or issues within the website or its platform integrations.
Design & Update: Implement regular website designs and updates using WordPress.

What You'll Need:
As a back-end developer, you should have a combination of technical expertise, curiosity, and an analytical mindset:

Experience: A minimum of 5 years in web development (both back end and front end).
Education: A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
Passion: A genuine enthusiasm for developing, troubleshooting, and improving user experience processes.
Skills: Strong programming and coding expertise.
Organization: Excellent prioritization and organizational skills.
Communication: Effective communication and teamwork abilities.
Technical Proficiency:
WordPress and Elementor
Symfony
CSS, HTML, PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, jQuery
Apache
Salesforce and its website integrations

Additional Skills:
Adobe Creative Suite: Familiarity with Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, etc.
Marketing Automation: Experience with Pardot.
Cloud Computing: Azure preferred.
Tech Savvy: Awareness of emerging technologies to enhance user experience.

Benefits of Joining Our Team:
Hands-On Experience: Gain valuable experience in data analysis and storytelling.
Meaningful Projects: Contribute to projects that positively impact organizational strategy and employee well-being.
Collaborative Environment: Enjoy an inclusive and collaborative workspace.
Certified B-Corporation: Work for an organization that uses business as a force for good.

What We Offer:
Paid Time Off: Enjoy 3 weeks of paid time off to recharge and refresh.
Healthcare: We cover a portion of individual healthcare premiums.
401(k): Benefit from a company match based on your contributions.
Professional Development: Access coaching through our "Work Bravely!" program.
Financial Wellness: Early pay access through Honeybee.
Tuition Reimbursement: Invest in your education with our support.
Mental Health Coaching: Receive support through UpRise Health.
Certified B-Corporation: Make a positive impact on the world.

Remote Work Policy:
We embrace remote work with employees in various locations, excluding California, Massachusetts, New York City, Washington, and locations outside of the United States.
Employment Type: Full-Time
Salary: $ 80,000.00 120,000.00 Per Year

Qualifications: As a back-end developer, you should have a combination of technical expertise, curiosity, and an analytical mindset:
Experience: A minimum of 5 years in web development (both back end and front end)
Education: A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience
Passion: A genuine enthusiasm for developing, troubleshooting, and improving user experience processes
Skills: Strong programming and coding expertise
Organization: Excellent prioritization and organizational skills
Communication: Effective communication and teamwork abilities
WordPress and Elementor
Symfony
CSS, HTML, PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, jQuery
Adobe Creative Suite: Familiarity with Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, etc
Marketing Automation: Experience with Pardot
Tech Savvy: Awareness of emerging technologies to enhance user experience
Hands-On Experience: Gain valuable experience in data analysis and storytelling
Meaningful Projects: Contribute to projects that positively impact organizational strategy and employee well-being
Certified B-Corporation: Work for an organization that uses business as a force for good

job_description:
Web/Mobile Developer – 6 M CTH - Pay $70 - $80 Per hour W-2 ONLY – Hybrid Cincinnati, OH 45212 Preferred / Remote - Key Skills: React, Node.
JS, .NET, API, SQL - NO C2C, NO Sponsorship

CBTS is searching for a Web/Mobile Developer focusing on building and maintaining integrations and custom solutions across Microsoft Dynamics, Workday, our in-house React-based mobile application (iOS & Android), and corporate website.

This is a hands-on role for someone who enjoys working across the full stack—front end, back end, APIs, and integrations—while partnering closely with enterprise systems, business stakeholders, and third-party vendors.

Responsibilities:
Enterprise Platforms & Integrations
Design, build, and maintain integrations between Microsoft Dynamics, Workday, and other internal and third-party systems
Develop and support RESTful APIs used by internal applications, the mobile app, and external partners
Ensure data consistency, security, and reliability across enterprise systems
Mobile Application Development
Build and support React-based mobile application for iOS and Android
Develop backend services and APIs to support mobile features and data access
Collaborate with product owners to deliver intuitive mobile experiences
Troubleshoot and resolve mobile app issues across platforms
Corporate Website Development
Develop and maintain features for corporate website
Build APIs and backend services that power website functionality
Ensure performance, accessibility, security, and search engine optimization best practices
Full Stack Development
Develop front-end components using modern JavaScript frameworks (React)
Build scalable backend services
Participate in code reviews, technical design discussions, and architecture planning
Collaboration & Operations
Partner with IT and business teams (Finance, HR, Clinical, Compliance, Marketing)
Work with vendors and integration partners when needed
Support CI/CD pipelines, deployments, monitoring, and production support
Contribute to technical documentation and system diagrams

3+ years of professional experience in full stack development

Strong experience with:
Front-end: React, JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, CSS

Back-end: , .NET

APIs:
RESTful API design and development

Databases:
SQL Server or comparable relational databases
Experience integrating enterprise platforms
Familiarity with authentication, authorization, and data security best practices
Strong communication and problem-solving skills

Preferences:
Experience working with Microsoft Dynamics (CE/CRM) and/or Workday
Experience supporting mobile applications (React Native)
Experience with Azure or other cloud platforms

job_description:
Description

About Our Team

Our employees thrive in a culture that's fast-paced and ego-free, where innovation and collaboration are encouraged at every turn. We are an organization that provides federal agencies instant access to experienced and talented professionals who understand their unique challenges and know the most efficient ways to address them. We are continually investing in resources and talent, so we stay prepared with specialized teams in the place who are experts in creating tailored technologies. Our solutions empower Federal organizations to grow, modernize, and succeed in a rapidly evolving landscape.

We welcome diverse perspectives and seek individuals who are passionate about technology and creative problem-solving. If you enjoy learning, growing, and tackling real-world challenges, you will thrive here. Veterans and military spouses are strongly encouraged to apply and bring their unique experience to our team.

About The Role

Our core values of People Matter, Integrity, and a Commitment to Excellence drive all that we do. By joining us, you will become a part of a fun and diverse team of talented and creative consultants who share the goal of using the latest technology to solve business challenges. We provide our clients with a dynamic mix of services and deliver focused solutions like no one else.

We are seeking talented and bright team players who are passionate about technology and want to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and ego-free culture while applying a creative approach to problem-solving. Team members who like to grow their skill sets while solving challenging, real world business problems thrive.

We are looking for an experienced PySpark & Delta Lake Developer, who will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable ETL pipelines to process and analyze large-scale healthcare claims data. This role emphasizes building robust Delta Lake tables and ensuring ACID-compliant data lakes. The ideal candidate will focus on developing efficient PySpark scripts and leveraging Delta Lake capabilities to deliver data reliability, high performance, and seamless schema evolution within an AWS environment.

Key Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and maintain robust ETL pipelines using PySpark and Delta Lake for large and complex healthcare data workloads.
• Implement and optimize data lake solutions using Delta Lake table formats, supporting ACID transactions, schema enforcement, and time travel.
• Write efficient, reusable, and well-documented PySpark scripts for data ingestion, transformation, cleansing, and aggregation.
• Collaborate with data engineers, architects, and data scientists to understand business and data requirements and translate them into scalable data solutions.
• Ensure data quality, consistency, lineage, and integrity across all stages of data processing.
• Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize PySpark applications and Delta Lake workflows for cost, speed, and reliability within AWS.
• Maintain detailed and up-to-date technical documentation of code, data pipelines, and standard operating procedures.
• Stay updated with the latest Delta Lake and Spark advancements, advocating for best practices in data management and analytics.

TAG: INDMJC

Tag

REQUIREMENTS

Required Qualifications
• Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark, with hands-on experience developing data pipelines.
• Advanced experience with Delta Lake and its ACID transaction and schema management features.
• Solid SQL skills for querying, joining, and optimizing data in distributed environments.
• Hands-on experience with AWS cloud data services (e.g., S3, Glue, EMR, Athena).
• Familiarity with data lake concepts, partitioning, and performance tuning.
• Excellent communication skills and a desire to continuously learn and adapt to innovative technologies.
• Familiarity with CI/CD, version control (e.g., Git), and infrastructure as code.

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with healthcare or claims data.
• Knowledge of data governance, security, data cataloging (AWS Glue Catalog), and compliance best practices.
• Strong ability to prioritize and execute tasks independently and within collaborative team environments.
• Previous experience working in a government or public sector setting.

Qualifications: Team members who like to grow their skill sets while solving challenging, real world business problems thrive

We are looking for an experienced PySpark & Delta Lake Developer, who will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable ETL pipelines to process and analyze large-scale healthcare claims data
Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark, with hands-on experience developing data pipelines
Advanced experience with Delta Lake and its ACID transaction and schema management features
Solid SQL skills for querying, joining, and optimizing data in distributed environments
Hands-on experience with AWS cloud data services (e.g., S3, Glue, EMR, Athena)
Familiarity with data lake concepts, partitioning, and performance tuning

job_title: Junior Web Developer at Abbexa Ltd Cambridge, MA
job_description:
Junior Web Developer job at Abbexa Ltd. Cambridge, MA.

Junior Web Developer This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to join a leading biotech company with branches in Cambridge (UK) , Houston (US) , and Leiden (NL) , providing products and services globally.
We are looking for a tenacious, competent, and organized individual to join our high-paced, dynamic IT Team in Bar Hill . You will be working with colleagues in other Teams to develop the front and back end of our website.
Responsibilities Identifying and fixing small and medium-sized bugs
Adding features to existing code in our web application
Working as part of the team on development projects
Adhering to SEO best practices for all tasks
Suggesting automation and/or improvements for front and back end processes and functionality
Skills and Experience Required:
University degree in computer science, IT (BSc, MSc, PhD), equivalent experience, or demonstrable interest in coding
1-3 years’ experience with PHP (at least intermediate level) and MySQL databases (at least intermediate level)
Ability to write, read, and interpret existing PHP code to understand the function and be able to debug the code
Advantageous:
Experience with Opencart
Ability to use MVC model and Git (version control system)
You will be organized, efficient, and practical. You will be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, enjoy working both alone and in a team, and be passionate about coding. You will excel in logical thinking and problem-solving, with a keen eye for detail. You will be an excellent communicator, both verbal and written, and have the ability to articulate technical content to non-technical stakeholders. You will enjoy challenges and be eager to learn.
Training will be provided. This role is 100% office-based in a large open-plan, newly refurbished modern office space.
About Us Abbexa believes in empowering individuals from an early stage. We seek to support you to draw your own personal career map in line with your ambitions and aspirations. Our informal and friendly culture is an ideal working environment to cultivate excellent professional development opportunities.
Abbexa is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, respect, fairness, and providing a positive environment for collaboration. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all our colleagues and applicants fairly and with respect.
Abbexa has been accredited as a Living Wage Employer. The Living Wage commitment means everyone working at Abbexa will receive the Living Wage, which is higher than the government minimum wage.
This is a full-time, permanent position. The hours are Monday - Friday, 8 am - 5 pm (one hour lunch). Please apply with CV.

#J-18808-Ljbffr Abbexa Ltd

Qualifications: University degree in computer science, IT (BSc, MSc, PhD), equivalent experience, or demonstrable interest in coding
1-3 years’ experience with PHP (at least intermediate level) and MySQL databases (at least intermediate level)
Ability to write, read, and interpret existing PHP code to understand the function and be able to debug the code
Experience with Opencart
Ability to use MVC model and Git (version control system)
You will be organized, efficient, and practical
You will be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, enjoy working both alone and in a team, and be passionate about coding
You will excel in logical thinking and problem-solving, with a keen eye for detail
You will be an excellent communicator, both verbal and written, and have the ability to articulate technical content to non-technical stakeholders
You will enjoy challenges and be eager to learn
Responsibilities: You will be working with colleagues in other Teams to develop the front and back end of our website
Responsibilities Identifying and fixing small and medium-sized bugs
Adding features to existing code in our web application
Working as part of the team on development projects
Adhering to SEO best practices for all tasks
Suggesting automation and/or improvements for front and back end processes and functionality
